lead_paragraph: The officers, who did not have a warrant, questioned those inside the home; the Police Department’s Internal Affairs Bureau and the Civilian Complaint Review Board disagree about the matter.

headline.print_headline: Conclusions Differ After Officers Enter Brooklyn Home
headline.main: Conflicting Conclusions Drawn After Officers Enter a Brooklyn Apartment

snippet: The officers, who did not have a warrant, questioned those inside the home; the Police Department’s Internal Affairs Bureau and the Civilian Complaint Review Board disagree about the matter.
abstract: Investigations by New York Police Dept and Civilian Complaint Review board into allegations that three officers conducted improper search of Crown Heights, Brooklyn, apartment in March reach differing conclusions; review board finds officers, who also stand accused of assaulting resident Jabbar Campbell, abused authority, while department calls claims unsubstantiated.
